item.title: 电网不稳定导致经济增长放缓
item.description: 电力驱动经济增长。几十年来，这种说法一直成立，负荷增长也不成问题。但是，各种因素的叠加给世界各地的电网带来了巨大压力，对经济增长造成了有形的拖累。【原文：Electricity drives growth. For decades, that’s held true and load growth hasn’t been a problem. But a confluence of factors is putting a huge amount of stress on grids around the world, and it’s creating a tangible drag on economic growth.】

item.title: 芬兰炼油企业耐斯特表示无法实现 2035 年石油出口目标
item.description: 芬兰的耐斯特公司（Neste Oyj）正在缩减部分气候目标，预计到 2035 年不会像之前计划的那样在其唯一的炼油厂停止使用原油。【原文：Finland’s Neste Oyj is scaling back some of its climate targets and doesn’t expect to stop using crude at its only oil refinery by 2035 as previously guided.】

item.title: 摩洛哥 20 多年来最严重的山洪造成 37 人死亡
item.description: 周日，摩洛哥沿海城市萨菲被暴雨淹没，造成至少 37 人死亡，这是北非国家 20 多年来遭遇的最致命的山洪暴发。【原文：At least 37 people died after torrential rains flooded the coastal Moroccan city Safi on Sunday, in the deadliest flash floods to hit the North African nation in over 20 years.】

item.title: 电力正阻碍全球经济增长
item.description:
根据最新研究，电网压力的增加导致资本支出下降。【原文：

The increase in grid stress leads to a decline in capital outlay, according to new research.

】

item.title: 中国化石燃料发电量十年来首次下降
item.description: 随着可再生能源大量涌入电网以满足日益增长的需求，中国化石燃料发电厂的年发电量将出现十年来的首次下降。【原文：China’s fossil fuel power plants are on track to chart their first annual drop in generation in a decade as renewables flood the grid to meet rising demand.】

item.title: 谷歌与 Shizen Energy 在马来西亚签署太阳能发电协议
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌公司在马来西亚签署了一项太阳能发电协议，这家科技巨头希望为其全球业务确保清洁电力。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google has signed a solar power agreement in Malaysia, as the tech giant looks to secure clean electricity for its operations globally.】

item.title: 中国面临拆除世界最大煤炭行业的代价
item.description:
从毛泽东时代起，燃料就一直支撑着经济增长、数百万个就业岗位和共产党的建党神话。【原文：

From the days of Mao Zedong, the fuel has underpinned economic growth, millions of jobs and the Communist Party’s founding myths.

】

item.title: 六年来第五次拉尼娜现象扰乱农作物和供应链
item.description:
气候模式的回归暴露了脆弱的粮食网络，加剧了全球风险。【原文：

The climate pattern’s return exposes fragile food networks and heightens risks worldwide.

】

item.title: 纽约大雪将于中午结束，气温将再次骤降
item.description: 随着一场快速移动的冬季风暴席卷美国东北部，纽约市的积雪将在周日中午左右逐渐减少，随后气温将在晴朗的天空下骤降。【原文：Snow should taper off in New York City by about midday on Sunday before temperatures plummet under clear skies later, as a quick moving winter storm sweeps through the US Northeast.】

item.title: 印度加强新德里污染控制，停止建筑施工
item.description: 在空气中的毒素突然激增之后，印度加强了对新德里及附近地区的污染控制。【原文：India stepped up anti-pollution curbs in New Delhi and nearby areas after a sudden spike in airborne toxins.】

item.title: 美国和墨西哥就解决格兰德河水争端达成协议
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普誓言征收额外关税几天后，美国和墨西哥同意结束与得克萨斯州边界的水源争端。【原文：The US and Mexico agreed to end a dispute over water at the border with Texas, days after President Donald Trump vowed to impose additional tariffs.】

item.title: 如何让房屋做好应对野火的准备
item.description: 希望适应日益凶猛的野火的房主们面临着一个悖论。虽然他们可以采取任何昂贵的升级措施来降低房屋被大火吞噬的几率，但如果他们的邻居不这样做，所有这些努力都可能付之东流。【原文：Homeowners looking to adapt to increasingly ferocious wildfires face a paradox. While they can undertake any number of costly upgrades to lower the odds their house is consumed by flames, if their neighbor doesn’t, all those efforts could be for naugh t.】

item.title: 欧洲试图为困于当下的汽车业争取时间
item.description: 欧洲陷入困境的汽车制造商将获得喘息的机会，因为他们正在努力向无排放驾驶过渡，这一关键时刻将决定欧洲大陆运输业未来的好坏。【原文：Europe’s embattled automakers are set to get a breather as they struggle with the transition to emission-free driving, a critical moment that will shape the future of the continent’s transport sector for better or worse.】

item.title: 科技热潮推动能源需求，绿色股票成为大赢家
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统推行其 "大石油 "议程的背景下，今年本应是绿色股票黯淡无光的一年。然而，随着人工智能推动了对各种能源的大量需求，该行业正在蓬勃发展。【原文：It was supposed to be a glum year for green stocks as President Donald Trump pushed his Big Oil agenda. Instead, the sector is booming as artificial intelligence powers massive demand for all kinds of energy.】

item.title: 美国贸易组织反驳欧盟简化甲烷规则的提议
item.description: 领先的贸易组织美国商会（US Chamber of Commerce）正在反击欧盟委员会提出的简化甲烷管理条例的建议，称该建议并没有解决 "核心的结构性缺陷"。【原文：The US Chamber of Commerce, a leading trade organization, is pushing back against a proposal by the European Commission to simplify its methane regulations rules, saying the offer stops short of fixing “core structural flaws.”】

item.title: 尼日利亚允许 28 家公司销售因燃烧而损失的天然气
item.description: 尼日利亚已经向 28 家公司发放了购买石油工业目前正在燃烧的天然气的许可证，因为这个西非国家正在努力减少排放，并从原本被浪费的资源中获得收入。【原文：Nigeria has granted permits to 28 firms to buy gas currently being burned off by the oil industry, as the West African nation seeks to cut emissions and earn revenue from a resource otherwise going to waste.】

item.title: 加拿大将于 2030 年开始建设耗资数十亿美元的高速铁路系统
item.description: 包括 Caisse de Depot et Placement du Quebec 和 AtkinsRealis Group Inc. 在内的一个财团将在大约四到五年内开始建设多伦多和魁北克市之间的高速铁路项目。【原文：A consortium including Caisse de Depot et Placement du Quebec and AtkinsRealis Group Inc. is set to start building a high-speed rail project between Toronto and Quebec City in about four to five years.】

item.title: 西北太平洋地区应对特大洪灾
item.description: 连续一周的无情降雨给西北太平洋地区带来了一场灾难。雨水不仅落在了山谷中；高温意味着山区也出现降雨，导致积雪减少，河流水位达到创纪录的洪水位。今天的时事通讯将为您介绍这场灾难的最新情况，包括降雨何时会最终减弱。【原文：A week of relentless rain has created a disaster in the Pacific Northwest. It hasn’t just fallen in the valleys; high temperatures mean rain also fell in the mountains, decimating snowpack and sending river levels to record flood levels. Today’s newsletter gives you the latest on the unfolding disaster, including when the rains will finally die down.】

item.title: 我不惜一切代价为加州下一场大火做准备
item.description:
野火准备工作要求进行昂贵的升级和重新美化后院。问题是，是否有房主能够独自成功。【原文：

Wildfire prep demands expensive upgrades and relandscaped backyards. The question is whether any one homeowner can succeed on their own. 

】

item.title: 南非就煤电厂污染豁免提起诉讼
item.description: 南非环境部 3 月份决定允许国有企业 Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd. 违反 8 家燃煤发电厂的排放规定，环保活动家因此对该部门提起诉讼。【原文：Environmental Activists sued South Africa’s environment department over its March decision to allow state-owned Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd. to breach emission rules at eight coal-fired plants.】

item.title: 锂可能因电池存储而获得亟需的需求推动力
item.description: 锂电大亨们将储能系统作为电池金属需求的下一个重要支柱，推动全球市场在多年供过于求之后恢复平衡。【原文：Lithium bulls are betting on energy storage systems as the next meaningful pillar of demand for the battery metal, nudging the global market back toward balance after years of oversupply.】

item.title: 住友商事将向印度可再生能源发电项目投资 13 亿美元
item.description: 住友商事株式会社将投资 2,000 亿日元（13 亿美元）建设几个印度可再生能源发电项目，以利用主要工业用户需求的快速增长。【原文：Sumitomo Corp. will invest 200 billion yen ($1.3 billion) on several Indian renewable power projects, to take advantage of rapid growth in demand from major industrial users.】

item.title: 特朗普废除拜登在阿拉斯加和其他州的土地保护措施
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统周四签署了几项国会措施，旨在撤销拜登政府限制在北极国家野生动物保护区和西部三个州的联邦土地上进行能源开发的土地保护政策。【原文：President Donald Trump on Thursday signed several congressional measures designed to undo Biden administration land conservation policies restricting energy development in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge and federal lands in three Western states.】

item.title: 华盛顿州洪水创历史纪录，十万人紧急撤离
item.description: 西雅图北部的斯卡吉特河（Skagit River）预计周四晚间将达到比历史最高纪录高出近两英尺（0.6 米）的水位，创纪录的降雨量促使约 10 万人发出了撤离令。【原文：Record rainfall prompted evacuation orders for about 100,000 people as the Skagit River north of Seattle is forecast to crest almost two feet (0.6 meter) above its historic record Thursday evening.】

item.title: 卡吉海军正在塑造特朗普的美国救灾愿景
item.description:
在特朗普政府重新考虑联邦救灾工作的同时，共和党人赞扬了卡吉海军团体应对大风暴的方式。【原文：

While the Trump administration rethinks federal disaster relief, Republicans have praised how Cajun Navy groups have responded to major storms.

】

item.title: 激励特朗普重塑救灾行动的团体
item.description: 今天的通讯主要介绍美国应对日益频繁的气候灾害的方式。首先是卡军海军。【原文：Today’s newsletter is all about the way the US responds to increasingly frequent climate disasters. First up, the Cajun Navy.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州石油开采产生的有毒水将被处理后泵入河流
item.description:
州环境监管机构正在评估四家公司向佩科斯河排放经过处理的二叠纪盆地废水的申请

。【原文：

State environmental regulators are evaluating applications from four companies to release treated Permian Basin wastewater into the Pecos River

】

item.title: 欧盟考虑对混合动力汽车实施为期五年的禁燃令
item.description: 在该地区一些最大的汽车生产国施加重压之后，欧盟正在权衡将内燃机禁令的有效期推迟五年。【原文：The European Union is weighing a five-year delay to its effective ban on the combustion engine after heavy pressure from some of the region’s biggest automotive countries.】

item.title: 加拿大的气候雄心是否就此终结？
item.description:
加拿大政治家史蒂文-吉尔伯特（Steven Guilbeault）向阿克沙特-拉蒂（Akshat Rathi）讲述了他为何因环境倒退而从马克-卡尼内阁辞职。【原文：

Canadian politician Steven Guilbeault tells Akshat Rathi why he resigned from Mark Carney’s cabinet over environmental rollbacks.

】

item.title: Ember 称，更便宜的电池储能可实现 "随时 "太阳能
item.description: 根据清洁能源智囊团微光（Ember）的最新分析，电池的成本越来越低，使太阳能发电可以在白天以外的时间使用。【原文：Batteries are getting cheaper and allowing solar power to be used beyond daylight hours, according to new analysis from clean energy think tank Ember.】
